title: Could not publish message
body:
## Description

I'm getting random "Could not publish message: InsufficientPeers" errors from libp2p when publishing attestations. I'm suspecting my internet connection to be the root cause of this. It's not down but it appears that there's quite a high packet drop rate.

So I'm getting errors that the message could not be published but lighthouse logs it as "Successfully published attestations". 

And seconds later I still receive ping requests form my connected peers while my peer count is still reported as 56?
I'm not quite sure what's going on there, maybe we could retry publishing if the connection is flimsy and drops random packets? And check for a libp2p publishing error before logging a successful attestation publication.

I tried it with a peercount of 50, 75, 100 and even 120.

## Version

1.0.6 (Downgraded from 1.1.0 since I had the same issue with random attestation misses on 1.1.0)

## Present Behaviour

- "Could not publish message" incorrectly leads to a "INFO Successfully published attestations log entry".
- InsufficientPeer error occurs but in the following logs 2 seconds later, the connected peer value is still at 56 and pings are received from peers? And it just discovered a hand full of peers a few seconds ago? Not quite sure what's going on there, might just be a connection issue on my side though.

## Expected Behaviour

- Accurately log the publish state.
- As for the second part of the issue, I'm not quite sure what's going on and what the expected behavior should be. 

## Steps to resolve

I suspect my internet connection is losing some UDP datagramms / ICMP. Maybe it can be reproduced that way?

## Logs
Logs are from 1.0.6.

@manuelsc
The `Successfully published attestations` log you are getting is a validator client log. It basically implies that the VC created a valid attestation and successfully sent it to the beacon chain via http api for the beacon chain to publish. It doesn't guarantee that the beacon chain published it correctly to the network.

Regarding the `InsufficientPeers` , there was a bug in 1.0.6 where we didn't drop the existing peer connections quickly enough during internet issues https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/2147 . It's possible that your peer count has in fact dropped because of your internet issues but it doesn't reflect in the logs. The issue has been fixed in 1.1.0. 

I suggest you upgrade to 1.1.0. If you loose peer connections because of internet issues, it will accurately show you how many peers you are still connected to.

@pawanjay176 thanks for the update. I tried 1.1.0 again which resolved the "Could not publish" errors. I still missed attestations but that was on me, for some reason the ntp client wasn't running. Sorry for the mistake, everything is working now :)

I also see something like this from time to time. My ISP is restricting incoming connections (I don't even get a valid external IP), so my BN's connectivity is poor from time to time, but I do have an Infura node as fallback. Unfortunately though the fallback is only used if the main BN is down or something like that. Would it be possible to add a flag to VC to send attestations/proposals to every BN, instead of only the first working? I suppose if the signed message is the same, this should be safe, right?
